reviews.review_msg: Elena, is a really good prof. She is really smart and expects a lot from her students but if you do the work, attend lecture and ask questions she will help you to achieve a good mark. She just wants the best.

She is so smart and I learned so much.  Probably the first time since arriving to SFU that I actually felt like I got my money's worth.  I learned so much about Aboriginal Issues.  Great, great, great prof!

Elena is an extremely helpful professor.She expects students to do the work required for a third year class.Her marking is fast and fair. Her class structure is great! she encourages discussion and is not like other professors who are too lazy to teach and just want students to ramble on about articles for two hours.She does her job properly!
Helpful if you talk to her, and a fair marker for a third year class.

She is a new professor, so yes, a bit disorganized and unsure of herself but actually talk to her and she is very helpful.  She is not a hard marker but she expects you to be at a third year university level and I would say she is rather fair.
Take this class! Sherri is awesome, and really is willing to go the extra mile to help you!

Great class. Final was hard, and her expectations were high, but she did not penalize heavily for not meeting those expectations so her grading was pretty easy. She is incredibly willing to help, with both her class, your other classes, and your future goals however she can. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Sherri is super nice and knows what she is talking about. The downside is that she marks HARD. There is no midterm for this class, therefore the final is cumulative,  in which she asks the MOST specific questions in which you need to cite the lectures, authors, and date in APA style (not fun). Paper was graded on the stricter side, but was fair.
No Comments
Male, not female, professor. Boring lectures, little relevence to text, does not engage the class. Fair marker. But he is a young instructor and will hopefully improve.
Don't waste your money on her; you'll get more value spending it on a golddigger.
She is great.

Cara is the greatest prof I've had at SFU. I've taken almost every class she has to offer and they are all great. She is quiet, but very knowledgeable and gets straight to the heart of the course concepts. Kind and always accessible I suggest anyone take one of her courses.

The best professor at SFU. Such an easy marker and the readings are relevant to lecture content! I've taken almost all of her courses at SFU and she's honestly such a sweet professor. She's always understanding of personal circumstances and gives extensions accordingly and she's really knowledgeable. Her expectations are very reasonable.

Terrible prof. I transfered to SFU from U of T to finish my Masters in political science and Cara was one of my first profs there. Super long lectures, and she didnt give clear instructions on the final paper. Ended up giving half of the class Cs because the question was worded so badly
She was okay, it seemed like she always had something better to do from the way she was always on her phone in class. All in all wasnt bad but definitely wouldnt take her again
Has no respect for men!!!
Avoid her at all costs. She has no idea what the heck she is doing.
She gives women higher marks and the men low marks. She makes you do a final exam in class. What a joke!!!!
A very caring and knowledgeable woman.  She is passionate and what she says in class will be on the exam. DO the work sheets.

Cara is one of the best profs I've had at SFU! She's super sweet and always willing to help. She gives a reasonable amount of readings & highlights the important pages. Her exams are pretty easy because she gives an awesome review handout WITH ALL THE QUESTIONS ON IT!  Only downside is that she plays a lot of videos. This is my 3rd class with Cara.

Cara is a professor who really wants to help her students understand what they are learning.  Always willing to stop lecture to hear your questions or critiques.  She is a fair marker and her exams are so straight  forward, ie. she gives you the questions before hand.  Only thing I hated about her class was all the group work, was pointless.

Took Canadian Environmental Politics with Cara.  Material was interesting but her lectures are excruciating and they will always go the full 4 hours.  There is way too much childish group work in-class as well.  20 percent of your grade depends on whether your peers decide to do their readings or pay attention in lecture or not, that's bs.

Cara is a top researcher and while her lecture can be a bit dry, she does present the material in a very accessible way.  She also goes over crucial material several times and the exam questions are pretty much given to you when she focuses in on a certain debate or topic.  Definitely learned a lot and was quite surprised with how well I did.
Always really clear on what he's looking for and understanding of how busy student life can be, enthusiastic and takes the time to fully explain challenging concepts
